question: How many Coulombs are required to oxidise 0.1 mole of <katex>$H_{2}O$</katex> to oxygen? [cite: 326]
explanation: Reaction: <katex>$H_2O \rightarrow \frac{1}{2}O_2 + 2H^+ + 2e^-$</katex>. For 1 mole water, 2F charge is needed. For 0.1 mole, 0.2F is needed. <katex>$0.2 \times 96500 = 19300$</katex> C. [cite: 329, 331]
